content:
I don't have access to details about aston martin's specific data collection process. generally, car manufacturers use a variety of sensors and data collection methods to gather data from their cars. these sensors are located throughout the car's various systems, including the engine, brakes, transmission, suspension, and electrical systems.

some common types of sensors that car manufacturers use to gather data include:

1. accelerometers - these sensors detect changes in motion and acceleration and can be used to measure the car's speed and movement.

2. gps -  global positioning system sensors are used to track the car's location and provide real-time traffic and routing information.

3. cameras - cameras can be used to capture images of the car's surroundings, allowing for the development of advanced driver assistance systems and other safety features.

4. microphones - these are used to capture audio data, such as engine noise or ambient sounds.

5. pressure sensors - these sensors are used to measure pressure in the car's tires, fuel injection system, and other systems to ensure optimal performance.

additionally, car manufacturers can gather data via infotainment systems, software updates, and customer feedback systems.
